Article Title: Elon Musk likely to become world’s first trillionaire by 2027: Report
Article Text:
Gautam Adani to get trillionaire status by 2028

Elon Musk is racing towards an unprecedented financial milestone. A new forecast by The Academy says that Musk may become the world’s first trillionaire by 2027. “With a net worth of $195 billion, growing at an average rate of 109.88% every year, Elon Musk is the clear favourite to become the first trillionaire by 2027,” it says.Elon Musk is the founder and CEO of the rapidly growing automotive company Tesla , the manufacturer of advanced rockets and spacecraft, SpaceX, and also owns X (formerly Twitter).In its ‘From Billionaire to Trillionaire’ list, the report states that the second entrepreneur to hit trillionaire status will be India’s businessman Gautam Adani, followed by Nvidia’s CEO Jensen Huang.Adani Group operates globally through various companies engaged in business activities that include power generation, transmission and distribution, ports and terminals, agriculture and general logistics, industrial parks, defense and aerospace incubation, airport management and others. The report says that Gautam Adani has an estimated net worth of $84billion and an average growth rate of 122.86% per year. He’s expected to become a trillionaire by 2028.Nvidia joined the $1 trillion club in May 2023. Its CEO and co-founder Jensen Huang is expected to become a trillionaire in 2028. He has an approximate net worth of $77 B and an average annual growth rate of 111.88%.The list also features names like Mark Zuckerberg (CEO, Meta), Steve Ballmer (former CEO, Microsoft), Larry Elison (former CEO, Oracle), Jeff Bezos (former CEO Amazon), Larry Page (Google co-founder) and Sergey Brin (Google co-founder). The list also includes Reliance Industries Limited Chairman Mukesh Ambani who is estimated to become a trillionaire by 2033.
Article Summary: Elon Musk is the founder and CEO of the rapidly growing automotive company Tesla. The second entrepreneur to hit trillionaire status will be India’s businessman Gautam Adani. The list also features names like Mark Zuckerberg (CEO, Meta), Steve Ballmer (former CEO, Microsoft), Larry Elison ( former CEO, Oracle) and Larry Page (Google co-founder)

Article Title: 35-year-old CEO shares biggest red flag he sees in employees: ‘The people that aren’t….’
Article Text:
Other hiring managers use similar techniques

What research shows

A 35-year-old CEO has sparked conversation by revealing what he considers to be the biggest red flag in employees. Everette Taylor , the CEO of Kickstarter , said that he values self-awareness in his employees above everything else. He believes that people without self-awareness tend to be ‘edo-driven’ and less willing to work with others.The CEO of crowdsourcing platform told CNBC that people without self-awareness are prone to “thinking inwardly about what they would want and what they think is best when it comes to customers,”.“I try to keep my ego at the door. I’m wrong all the time. I have an incredible team that’s super smart and will put me in my place, and I love that,” he added. He told the publication that he works on bullying his own self-awareness whenever possible.Intentionally tailors job questions to focus on self-awarenessTaylor said that he intentionally tailors job interview questions to focus on traits like self-awareness and ego control. He said that he asks about moments when the candidate got something wrong, or did something that failed. By asking these questions, he learns about the candidate’s ability to take accountability.“You can really tell,” says Taylor. “The people that aren’t self-aware, they really struggle with this.”The report quotes ex-Google VP Claire Hughes Johnson asking candidates “how their colleagues would describe them. If they only say good things, I probe what constructive feedback they’ve received.”Writing for Make It last year, she said, “Then I’ll say, ‘And what have you done to improve?’ to check their orientation towards learning and self-improvement, and to see whether they’ve taken that feedback to heart,”.Hughes Johnson said she listens closely for two words throughout any interviewee’s answers: Too many “I”s signify a lack of humility, and too many “we”s mean an inability to take credit appropriately.Researcher and author Tasha Eurich found in 2018 that the self-awareness trait can help you bolster your communication, relationships, creativity and productivity. However, while 95% of people believe they’re self-aware, only 10% to 15% genuinely are, the research shows.
Article Summary: Everette Taylor, CEO of Kickstarter, said that he values self-awareness in his employees above everything else. He believes that people without self- awareness tend to be ‘edo-driven’ and less willing to work with others. He intentionally tailors job interview questions to focus on traits like self-aware and ego control.

Article Title: How OpenAI CTO Mira Murati's mother’s first ChatGPT question is a 'classic mom' moment
Article Text:
“When will Mira…?” she asked

What ChatGPT responded to Murati’s mother’s question

OpenAI CTO Mira Murati recently shared a funny incident about her mother's first encounter with ChatGPT – the company’s AI chatbot that is seen to be responsible for bringing AI technology into people’s hands. It turns out her mom's inaugural question was a classic one, essentially echoing the sentiments of Indian mothers.In a recent interview at Cannes Lions 2024, Murati was talking in the presence of creative and communications professionals.According to a report by Business Insider, she also spoke about what her mother’s first question to the AI chatbot was.Murati said that her mother asked ChatGPT, “When will Mira get married?”Murati's sister, who was helping their mother through that first encounter with the AI chatbot, responded, “Well, mom, it's not magic. It's still artificial intelligence,” Murati said.Murati noted that since ChatGPT enables skillful conversation, “she was having such a natural interaction with it that she thought she could ask anything,” Murati said.ChatGPT generated the response in a most chatbot-like way possible:“There is no public information about Mira Murati's personal plans, including if or when she intends to get married. Like many public figures, she tends to keep her private life out of the spotlight.”Born in Albania, Murati pursued her education in engineering and research, leading her to become a key player in the development of AI models like ChatGPT, DALL-E, and GPT-4.Murati was also the face when OpenAI launched GPT-4o – the company’s multimodal large language model that can take text, photo and video as input to generate responses.During her tenure at the company, she has also briefly served as the interim CEO of OpenAI, when OpenAI's board of directors ousted co-founder and CEO Sam Altman after the board had no confidence in his leadership.
Article Summary: Mira Murati's mother asked ChatGPT, “When will Mira get married?” Murati: “Well, mom, it's not magic. It's still artificial intelligence,” she said. Murati was the face of GPT-4o, the company's multimodal language model.

Article Text:
YouTube ‘doctor’ missing

A 15-year-old boy tragically lost his life after a botched gallbladder stone removal surgery performed by a fraudulent doctor in Saran district, Bihar . The doctor, identified as Ajit Kumar Puri, who allegedly relied on YouTube tutorials to guide the procedure, is currently at large.The teenager, admitted to Puri's clinic in Madhaura on Friday night due to vomiting and stomach pain, was operated on without his family's knowledge or consent.Alarmingly, the family alleges that Puri was performing the surgery while watching YouTube videos on his mobile phone.As the boy's condition worsened during the operation, the family expressed concern. Puri reportedly responded dismissively, "Am I the doctor here or you?"Despite the deteriorating situation, Puri eventually decided to transport the boy to a hospital in Patna. However, the teenager passed away during the journey. Puri then fled the scene, leaving the boy's body behind.The family has filed a police complaint against Puri, accusing him of negligence, malpractice, and operating without proper qualifications or experience. They assert that his actions directly led to the teenager's untimely death.A case has been registered against the fake doctor and his clinic staff. Local police are conducting raids to apprehend the accused. The boy's body has been sent for a post-mortem examination.
Article Summary: A 15-year-old boy tragically lost his life after a botched gallbladder stone removal surgery performed by a fraudulent doctor in Saran district, Bihar. The doctor, identified as Ajit Kumar Puri, who allegedly relied on YouTube tutorials to guide the procedure, is currently at large.

Flipkart’s Big Billion Days Sale 2024 is one of the most highly anticipated events in India’s e-commerce calendar. Starting from September 30, 2024, this mega sale promises to offer enormous discounts across various product categories, aligning with the festive shopping demand for Dussehra and Diwali. Early access will be available for Flipkart Plus members on September 29, 2024, allowing them to secure deals on popular products before general access begins.This detailed guide covers all aspects of the sale, including the dates, product categories with expected discounts, early access benefits, and tips to maximise your savings during the event.Compared to last year’s event, which began on October 8, 2023, this year’s sale starts earlier, accommodating the heightened demand during the festive season. The earlier start aligns well with Indian festivals, making it convenient for shoppers preparing for Dussehra and Diwali.The Big Billion Days Sale is renowned for offering some of the deepest discounts across several product categories. Here’s a breakdown of the expected discounts in major categories:Customers can expect discounts ranging from 50% to 80% on a wide array of electronics and accessories. These deals will include laptops, headphones, gaming consoles, and other tech accessories.One of the most lucrative categories during the sale, smart TVs and home appliances may see discounts of up to 80%. Select items like refrigerators and 4K smart TVs will have discounts of up to 75%, making this an excellent opportunity to upgrade home appliances.Brands such as Nothing, Realme, Mi, and Infinix are expected to offer significant discounts on their smartphones. Additionally, special bank offers will be available for a limited time, further enhancing the savings on popular models, including possible deals on premium smartphones like the iPhone.Flipkart’s Big Billion Days Sale isn’t just about product discounts. Customers can also benefit from a range of additional savings options, including:To ensure you get the best deals and avoid missing out on popular products, it’s important to plan ahead. Here are some tips for making the most of Flipkart’s Big Billion Days Sale:By activating a Flipkart Plus Membership, you gain early access to the sale, a significant advantage for securing top deals before items sell out. This is particularly important for high-demand products such as smartphones and electronics.To save time and ensure that you don’t miss out on deals, create a wishlist of the items you want to buy before the sale starts. This makes it easy to access and purchase your desired products quickly once the sale goes live.Visit the Flipkart Big Billion Days microsite regularly for updates and sneak peeks of upcoming deals. Flipkart often reveals exclusive discounts and offers leading up to the sale, providing an opportunity to strategize your purchases.The Big Billion Days Sale has become synonymous with the festive shopping season in India. Each year, the event not only offers massive discounts but also reflects the rising demand for consumer electronics, home appliances, and other products as customers prepare for the festivities. From Dussehra to Diwali, this sale is perfectly timed for Indian families looking to upgrade their gadgets, purchase gifts, and decorate their homes for the season.The sale also provides customers with access to a wide range of financial tools such as exchange programs, no-cost EMI, and cashback offers, ensuring that everyone can participate in this shopping extravaganza, regardless of their budget.
Article Summary: Flipkart’s Big Billion Days Sale 2024 is one of the most highly anticipated events in India's e-commerce calendar. Starting from September 30, 2024, this mega sale promises to offer enormous discounts across various product categories. Early access will be available for Flipkart Plus members on September 29, 2024. This detailed guide covers all aspects of the sale, including the dates, product categories with expected discounts, and early access benefits.

The widely popular Telegram-based crypto tap-to-earn game has just revealed the code word and card combinations that could earn you up to 6 million tokens for free.Since its launch in March 2024, Hamster Kombat has seen explosive growth, attracting over 200 million users globally. The viral clicker game centres around a Hamster who acts as the CEO of a simulated virtual crypto exchange.Players are tasked with supporting this ambitious rodent by mining coins and upgrading the exchange’s level.As a reward for their efforts, players can earn free bonuses. Mining in Hamster Kombat is simple—just tap on the Hamster icon until your energy bar is depleted.The Daily Cipher Code and Combo Card are special challenges within the game designed to reward players with even more tokens. The Daily Cipher Code is a task where players must decipher a word using Morse code. Successfully cracking the code within the 24-hour time limit can earn you 1 million coins.The Daily Combo Card is a challenge that requires players to correctly choose three cards from the game’s upgrade categories: PR & Team, Markets, Legal, Specials, and Web3. Completing this challenge can net you an additional 5 million coins. Like the Cipher Code, the Combo Card is updated daily.The Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher code for today is “WITHDRAW.” Enter the code using the Morse sheet given below and earn up to 1 million coins.▬ Long Tap● Short TapW: ● ▬ ▬I: ● ●T: ▬H: ● ● ● ●D: ▬ ● ●R: ● ▬ ●A: ● ▬W: ● ▬ ▬To activate the Daily Cipher mode, simply go to the "Exchange" tab and press the "Daily Cipher" button. Once activated, enter the daily Morse code using the following tapping patterns:
Article Summary: Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher code for September 03, 2024 is WITHDRAW. Today's morse code is: WIT HDRAW. To solve today’s cipher:Tap once for a dot (•).Tap and hold for a dash (—).Wait at least 1.5 seconds between each letter sequence to ensure proper registration in the game.

Expected updates include minor design changes, new buttons for custom actions and camera functions, and enhanced camera features.

Article Title: Did Pavel Durov went under the knife? His transformation raises eyebrows
Article Text:
Pavel Durov's rise to fame

Durov's recent legal troubles

Pavel Durov’s transformation: Then vs. Now

Social media reactions on Durov’s transformation

Impact of public scrutiny

Also read

Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram , has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance. Adding to the intrigue, Durov was recently arrested in France, raising further questions about the man behind the popular messaging app.Pavel Durov, a 39-year-old entrepreneur originally from Russia, is best known as the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013.Telegram quickly gained popularity for its strong emphasis on user privacy, offering end-to-end encryption and other security features that set it apart from competitors. As of now, Forbes estimates Durov's net worth to be around $15.5 billion. Despite his success in the tech industry, Durov has managed to maintain a relatively low profile—until now.Durov's recent arrest in Paris has added a new layer of complexity to his public image. He was detained in France on charges of suspected complicity in running an online platform involved in illicit activities, including child exploitation, drug trafficking, and fraud. While these allegations are serious, it is the sudden focus on Durov's physical transformation that has captured the internet's attention.Pavel Durov has been active on social media platforms like Instagram since 2011, regularly sharing photos from his travels around the world. In his recent posts, Durov appears with a full head of hair and a toned physique, often posing shirtless in various locations. However, these recent images stand in stark contrast to older photos where Durov was seen with a noticeably receding hairline.The drastic change in his appearance has fueled rumours that Durov may have undergone plastic surgery, including a possible hair transplant. A popular post on X (formerly Twitter) by a well-known account shared a side-by-side comparison of Durov's old and new photos, sparking a flurry of online discussions. The post reads, "Pavel Durov (Telegram CEO) before his hair transplant and plastic surgery," and has since gone viral.The speculation around Durov's transformation has been met with a variety of opinions online. On Reddit, users have debated whether the changes in Durov's appearance are the result of surgical procedures or simply better grooming and styling.One Reddit user commented, "This isn't a hair transplant. His hair is too thick and full to have this kind of drastic change from a HT. Most likely he's wearing a hair system (wig)."Another user added, "There's speculation that it's not a transplant, but rather a hair system because his hair loss was much more advanced in the first picture, so when the operation happens, the resulting hairdo never looks as full as his."Some users believe the changes are the result of plastic surgery, with one theorising, "This is well-done surgery."However, not everyone is convinced that surgery is involved. One Reddit user opined, "Honestly, I think a lot of the facial 'changes' are simply due to the much better angle and lighting in the second photo."As the speculation continues, it's clear that Durov's transformation—whether natural or assisted—has caught the public's eye. The intense scrutiny of his appearance highlights the challenges that come with being in the spotlight, especially for someone as private as Durov. Whether or not he has undergone any procedures, the discussions around his looks reflect a broader societal fascination with image and success.
Article Summary: Pavel Durov, 39, is the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013. He has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance.

Article Title: When Tesla CEO Elon Musk called Ratan Tata a “gentleman and …”
Article Text:
Tata Nano and the Indian automobile market

Elon Musk praised Ratan Tata

The legacy of the Tata Nano

Also read

In the realm of business and innovation, few figures command as much respect as Tata Group chairman emeritus Ratan Tata. His influence extends far beyond the Indian corporate world, even garnering admiration from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose , Musk praised Ratan Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar." This moment has recently resurfaced, shedding light on Musk's appreciation for Ratan Tata and his ambitious project, the Tata Nano .The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time). The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. The idea was revolutionary—a small, affordable car that would cater to the vast Indian middle class, providing them with a safe and efficient means of transportation.In the interview with Charlie Rose, which took place shortly after the launch of the Tata Nano, the Tesla CEO was asked about his views on Ratan Tata’s efforts to introduce a low-cost car in India. The interview clip, which has recently gone viral, captures Musk's candid response."Take for a moment Ratan Tata, what he’s doing in India — developing a little sedan for $2300. Where do you put that in the whole equation of where the future of cars is?" asked Rose.Musk responded with a mix of admiration and caution. He began by acknowledging the brilliance behind the Tata Nano project and the character of Ratan Tata himself."I think it's a good idea to have affordable cars, but I think the problem with something like the Nano ... I wouldn't say problem because I think, by the way, it is probably a great idea and Ratan is a gentleman and scholar," Musk said.However, Musk also expressed his concerns about the long-term viability of such a low-cost vehicle, particularly in the context of rising fuel prices. He pointed out that while the initial purchase cost of the Nano was remarkably low, the cost of running the car—particularly fuel costs—could become a significant issue as gasoline prices continued to rise."But where it’s going to become challenging in the future is when the price of gasoline rises, the cost of acquiring the car is much less of an issue than the cost of running the car," the billionnaire explained.Despite the initial excitement surrounding the Tata Nano, the car faced numerous challenges. One of the most significant issues was its branding. While the Nano was intended to be an affordable vehicle for the masses, it was often labeled as "cheap" rather than "affordable." This perception problem, combined with safety concerns and competition from other small cars, led to unimpressive sales figures.The Nano’s production was ultimately discontinued in 2018, marking the end of what was initially seen as a groundbreaking project. The car's journey from inception to discontinuation is often cited as one of the biggest marketing failures in the automobile industry.
Article Summary: The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time) The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose, Musk praised Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar"

Article Title: Donald Trump has found a role for Elon Musk in the US government
Article Text: Donald Trump announced his intention to form a government efficiency commission with Elon Musk as its head if he is elected President. The commission will audit the federal government to identify and eliminate fraud and improper payments. Trump also outlined proposals to cut regulations, boost energy production, adopt cryptocurrencies, and reduce corporate taxes for US-based companies.
Article Summary: The commission will audit the federal government to identify and eliminate fraud and improper payments. Trump also outlined proposals to cut regulations, boost energy production, adopt cryptocurrencies, and reduce corporate taxes for US- based companies. The commission will be headed by Elon Musk if he is elected President.

Article Title: Bengaluru-based Dunzo lays off 75% employees, reduces workforce to 50
Article Text:
Dunzo sends email to employees

Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. Citing unknown sources aware of the matter, the report said that the online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams.The job cuts , according to the report, is part of the company's broader effort to curb costs and create cash flow to address mounting liabilities, including overdue salaries to current and former employees and outstanding vendor payments. Layoffs .fyi - the online tracker show that the job cuts were made on August 31, 2024.As per the report, Dunzo has sent an email to its employees informing them about the recent downsizing. In the letter, Dunzo promises to pay pending salaries, severance, leave encashment, and other dues to affected staff as soon as it secures the necessary funds.Dunzo, which started as a concierge service, has undergone multiple shifts and challenges. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round. In May this year, Dunzo was reportedly close to securing $22-25 million through a mix of equity and debt from both new and existing investors.In mid-July this year, the company informed its employees that it was in the final stages of closing a deal, expecting to settle dues within 10-15 days. However, the transaction failed to materialize with subsequent emails revealing persistent delays and challenges.The company is now seeking to diversify its revenue sources beyond its primary merchant-focused operations.
Article Summary: Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. The online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round.

Article Title: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal slams Elon Musk’ X: “just look at Twitter’s arm twisting of the Brazilian Supreme Court”
Article Text:
Take a look at Bhavish Aggarwal’s post on X

Elon Musk criticizes Brazil ban on X



Delhi High Court warns Wikipedia

Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has once again reiterated his stance on fostering the Indian technology sector. Aggarwal took to microblogging site X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views on the latest report of Delhi High Court slamming Wikipedia over non-compliance with Indian laws.In the post, he wrote “Another proof of why we need to build our tech stack in India. These platforms don’t even comply with Indian laws and then even ignore court judgements!”.But he did not stop there.Aggarwal took aim at Elon Musk 's social media platform, Twitter, leveraging the Wikipedia incident to slam the platform. He said “Also, just look at Twitter’s arm twisting of the Brazilian Supreme Court .”“The more we ignore and justify, more we risk,” he further added.Recently, Brazil Supreme Court banned X after a protracted legal battle. The battle started in April this year when Judge de Moraes directed X to suspend several accounts alleged to be disseminating false information. X's refusal to follow this order resulted in the current suspension in addition to a penalty of 50,000 reais (approximately Rs. 7.47 lakh) for any efforts to bypass the ban, including the use of VPNs.Elon Musk reacted to the announcement with fury, dubbing Moraes as ‘evil dictator’.The Delhi High Court threatened Wikipedia to block the website if it doesn’t comply with India’s laws. Justice Navin Chawla delivered the warning during a hearing related to a defamation case filed by news agency ANI against Wikipedia."If you don't like India, please don't work in India... We will ask government to block your site," Justice Chawla declared, as reported by legal news website Bar and Bench.
Article Summary: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal took to X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views on the latest report of Delhi High Court slamming Wikipedia over non- compliance with Indian laws. He also took aim at Elon Musk's social media platform, Twitter, leveraging the Wikipedia incident.
